job_title: Staff RN in Safety Harbor, FL
pros: Worked as a RN.  Went as a traveler and stayed.  My unit was well supported, the CN3's were supportive and weren't afraid to get their hands dirty.  Same for unit managers.  Corporate was as good as any of them and bettter than most.  They seemed to care, which can be hard to find these days.  Pay is fair and willing to pay extra for those really critical shifts.  I recommend them all the time and will continue. Self-scheduling.  Great seasonal program for those wanting to travel!
cons: Crazy, but really don't have any.  Has the normal issues, problem docs here and there but they try to stay on top of it .  Charting needs much improvement!

job_title: Clinical Nurse II in Safety Harbor, FL
pros: Baycare Health System is a great company to work for. They really truly care about everyone that comes through their doors-employees(whom they call "team members"), patients and visitors alike. Team members are very professional and positive and friendly.
cons: I can't think of any cons. The only con that I can think of is that I have had to leave this company following the birth of my son because I have had to move to MA to be closer to family and there are no Baycare Health hospitals present in MA.

job_title: PCT Med/Surg in Safety Harbor, FL
pros: Pay is good if you are a float or have experience. otherwise its 11-12 for new, full time PCT's. They give you a lot of good training. Always make sure you get a lunch and break. Parking is always available. Emergency room staff is very helpful and friendly when recieving a pateint. Tuition assistance. They accommodate school schedules. Transporters are friendly and helpful. Enough supplies and resources always available.
cons: It is a very clique oriented workplace. Especially  on the regular floors outside of the ER. Nurses and techs choose who they help and although management tries to stop that, theres little they can do to stop employees from giving new people or floaters the cold shoulder. The women who work here are unbelievably territorial and rude sometimes. All about looks, make sure you come to work with makeup on and hair done. The higher ups treat PCT's as if they are extremely below them or like children. egos run high here.  Gotta know someone in order to get in with baycare. And if you are a tech, be prepared to get asked at least 5 times a day if you are in school. My clinical educator told me in my inital orientation that her goals for me were to further my education aka not be a tech for very long. such BS how they treat the aides who are basically the heart of the hospital. We have 9-12 patients a shift. Nurses get 4-5. My team was never very warm to me and i worked here for 4 years. They are not strict enough on night shift. day shift gets to pick up after them.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Safety Harbor, FL
pros: Great coworkers and management, they often bring in pizza or doughnuts. They also try to be accommodating with changing schedule for school or family needs.
cons: Lots of extra assignments and meetings. The extra education is never ending, the meetings are usually very boring. It's all to please corporate and get more money. The benefits are also not the best. Only 3 paid holidays and only paid if you work the day. No "sick" days, you have to use your vacation time. Insurance is also expensive.

job_title: Chaplain Resident in Wetumpka, AL
pros: Excellent living definition of team work from President on down. I received 3 raises within a year without requesting one.  I worked there 9 months before I heard anyone complain about the workload - very positive environment. Genuine heart to help patients improve health.
cons: Seriously, this is as bad as it gets: the cafeteria has some type of unhealthy infatuation with the use of rosemary.

job_title: in Tampa, FL
pros: Great Management in Operating Room. Enjoyed Co-workers. Lots of educational opportunities and training. Good benefits.
cons: Promotions were few and far between unless you went outside the hospital in to the Bay Care system...the good positions were taken and held on to tightly
